block.p: Stephanie Elenore Lambidakis, a daughter of Elenore and Paul Lambidakis of Takoma Park, Md., was married last evening to John Hutchins LeSeur, the son of Shirley and John LeSeur of Batavia, N.Y. The Rev. Basil Kissal performed the ceremony at Sts. Constantine and Helen Greek Orthodox Church in Washington.

The bride, 37, is a producer for the ''CBS Evening News'' and a reporter for CBS Radio, based in Washington. Ms. Lambidakis, who is keeping her name, graduated from Indiana University of Pennsylvania. Her father, who is retired, was an electrical engineer at the Department of Agriculture. Her mother, also retired, was a freelance editor and writer in Takoma Park.

Stephanie Elenore Lambidakis, a daughter of Elenore and Paul Lambidakis of Takoma Park, Md., was married last evening to John Hutchins LeSeur, the son of Shirley and John LeSeur of Batavia, N.Y. The Rev. Basil Kissal performed the ceremony at Sts. Constantine and Helen Greek Orthodox Church in Washington.

The bride, 37, is a producer for the ''CBS Evening News'' and a reporter for CBS Radio, based in Washington. Ms. Lambidakis, who is keeping her name, graduated from Indiana University of Pennsylvania. Her father, who is retired, was an electrical engineer at the Department of Agriculture. Her mother, also retired, was a freelance editor and writer in Takoma Park.

Mr. LeSeur, 44, is a partner in Slover & Loftus, a Washington law firm. He graduated from Dartmouth College and received a law degree from Georgetown University. His father, who is retired, practiced law in Batavia.
